summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 regarding travel and hotel arrangements for a witness and her family to attend the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in New York. It includes a forwarded hotel confirmation for a stay at Hotel 50 Bowery from September 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the upcoming trial for which travel arrangements are being made.

persons.name: Sandra Ramos
persons.context: Executive Assistant at Freedom Hospitality who provided the hotel confirmation for Hotel 50 Bowery.

persons.name: Anthony Toliver
persons.context: Copied on an email from Sandra Ramos regarding the hotel confirmation.

events.title: Planned Travel for Maxwell Trial
events.description: A witness and her family plan to travel to New York to attend the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, with intended travel dates from December 1 to December 7, 2021.

events.title: Hotel Stay at Hotel 50 Bowery
events.description: A reservation was confirmed for a stay at Hotel 50 Bowery in New York City.

locations: Hotel 50 Bowery, 50 Bowery, New York, NY 10013-4801, US
United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Freedom Hospitality, 100 Park Avenue, 16th Floor, New York, NY 10017
keyFacts: Travel arrangements were being coordinated in November 2021 for a witness and her family to attend the Ghislaine Maxwell trial in New York.
The correspondence involves a Victim Witness Coordinator from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
A hotel confirmation for Hotel 50 Bowery from September 16-19, 2021, is included in the email chain.
The email discusses logistical details like flying together with the witness's mother and using a car service.
The document shows the administrative and logistical support provided by the government to witnesses for the Maxwell trial.
